string-array.name: question
string-array.item: When do you plan to make a signiicant lump sum withdrawal from your portfolio, for example, for the purchase of a irst home or for retirement needs? (From age 65 at the earliest)
Which of the following questions best describes your thoughts about risks and returns?
Protecting my investment portfolio from a fall in value at any time is more important to me than achieving high returns?

Consider you have an investment balance of at least $20,000 or more. If after a short period of time (less than 1 year) your balance has dropped in value, which statement relects best how you would feel about this?
How often would you tend to worry about your investment returns?

resources.string: When do you plan to make a signiicant lump sum withdrawal from your portfolio, for example, for the purchase of a irst home or for retirement needs? (From age 65 at the earliest)

string-array.name: question01_answer
string-array.item: Within 2 years – you need a DEFENSIVE TYPE fund
In 2 to 5 years – you need a CONSERVATIVE TYPE fund
In 6 to 10 years – continue to next question
In 11 to 20 years – continue to next question
More than 20 years – continue to next question

string-array.name: question02_answer
string-array.item: I want to minimise my risk and am therefore willing to accept low returns
I am willing to take a moderate amount of risk to generate low to medium returns
I am willing to take a reasonable amount of risk to provide a more medium return
In order to receive higher returns, I am willing to take a relatively high amount of risk
I want to maximise my returns and am willing to accept a high level of risk

string-array.name: question03_answer
string-array.item: Strongly Agree
Agree
Neither agree or disagree
Disagree
Strongly Disagree

string-array.name: question04_answer
string-array.item: I would be unhappy with any drop in value
I would be OK with a drop in value of no more than 5%
I would be OK with a drop in value of no more than 10%
I would be OK with a drop in value of up to 15%
I would be OK with a drop in value of up to 20%

string-array.name: question05_answer
string-array.item: Daily
Monthly
Quarterly
Annually
Never or only occasionally over the longer term

resources.string: Which of the following questions best describes your thoughts about risks and returns?
Protecting my investment portfolio from a fall in value at any time is more important to me than achieving high returns?

Consider you have an investment balance of at least $20,000 or more. If after a short period of time (less than 1 year) your balance has dropped in value, which statement relects best how you would feel about this?
How often would you tend to worry about your investment returns?
